N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).

formula: For 2 <= n <= 7, equals (n+1)!*n/2. - _Alexander R. Povolotsky_, Oct 16 2006
maple: with(combinat): for n from 0 to 35 do big := 1: for m from 1 to n do if big < n!*binomial(n-1,m-1)/m! then big := n!*binomial(n-1,m-1)/m! fi: od: printf(`%d,`,big): od:
mathematica: a[n_] := ( big = 1; For[ m = 1 , m <= n, m++, b = n!*Binomial[n - 1, m - 1]/m!; If[ big < b , big = b ]]; big); Table[a[n], {n, 0, 19}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Sep 21 2012, after Maple *)
